title: Linux cron Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the powerful cron service in Linux, learn how to schedule and manage cron jobs, and configure notifications and logging for effective system maintenance.

steps.title: Understanding the cron Service and Crontab

verify.name: Verify cron service status
verify.hint: The cron service should be active and running. Please check the status of the cron service using the `systemctl status cron` command.

verify.name: Verify cron job execution
verify.hint: The cron job should be running every minute and appending the current date and time to the `cron_output.log` file. Please check the contents of the `cron_output.log` file to ensure the cron job is executing correctly.

verify.name: Verify cron email notifications
verify.hint: The cron job output should be sent to the `labex@example.com` email address. Check the `/var/mail/labex` file to ensure the email notification is being received.

verify.name: Verify cron logging
verify.hint: The cron service should be logging detailed information to the `/var/log/cron.log` file. Check the log file to ensure the cron job execution is being logged.
